snippet: A triple-tiered board with historical status is likely to remain even as an amphitheater is built atop a pool in Queens that it has long stood above.
abstract: Disused public pool in Astoria, Queens, art deco structure built in the 1930s, will be converted into an outdoor amphitheater; complex has been declared a landmark, which means changes will require review by New York City's Landmarks Preservation Commission; triple-tiered Bauhaus-style diving board will likely remain.
lead_paragraph: A triple-tiered board with historical status is likely to remain even as an amphitheater is built atop a pool in Queens that it has long stood above.

headline.seo: Diving Board in Queens Set for 2nd Career in Theater
headline.main: Diving Board Is Set to Begin a Second Career in the Theater
headline.print_headline: Diving Board Is Set to Begin A 2nd Career In the Theater
